授業目的: 授業の目的は、１）経済成長の理論、２）日本、アジア４大虎（韓国、台湾、香港、シンガポール）、中国、インドの経済成長の歴史的経験、３）今世紀中のこれらのアジア経済の将来の成長の見通し。を理解することです。 このコースは、学生がグローバル経済に積極的に参加できるよう準備するのに役立ちます。
到達目標: これらの目標を達成するために、学生はアジアの経済成長に関する最新の文献を読み、講義で経済理論と政策について学び、授業でさまざまな視点の相対的な長所と短所について話し合います。このコースは英語の読解力、リスニング力、スピーキング力を向上させます。経済学の語彙力を向上させ、批判的な経済的思考スキルを向上させます。

関連科目: International Economics A・B, Development Economics A・B, Labor Economics A・
授業の概要・背景:
This course is geared for undergraduate students. We first learn the theory of economic growth. We study how Japan became the first non-Western country to become a first world country and why growth slowed down after 1990. We explore the similarities and differences with the Four Asian Tigers along with the 1997 Asian Financial Crisis. We examine Chinese economic growth after 1978 and its recent slowdown. And we look at the prospects for India and its economic reforms.

Graduate students will be expected to write a term paper based on the course material. The term paper should at least consist of objectives, theoretical considerations, empirical considerations, policy considerations and concluding remarks followed by references.
授業方法: The lectures will be in English and conducted face to face in a classroom. The lectures will be accompanied by PowerPoint slides. Copies of the slides will be made available. Questions and discussion will be encouraged. Discussion questions will be provided ahead of time. The course readings are in English and will be provided to the class. There will be a midterm exam and a final exam administered in class. The exams will be closed book and closed notes.
